column4: Eva Zlotnicka elected to the Board of Unifi
column5: Aug 1 (Reuters) - Yarn manufacturing company Unifi Inc announced the election of Eva Zlotnicka to the Board of Directors on Wednesday.
column6: Zlotnicka previously worked as a Vice President in the U.S. hedge fund ValueAct Capital.
column7: San Francisco-based ValueAct, which oversees roughly $16 billion in assets, had moved into the socially responsible field with a new fund few months back and hired Zlotnicka in February.
column8: ValueAct Spring Master Fund is currently one of Unifi’s largest investors. (Reporting by Mekhla Raina in Bengaluru Editing by James Dalgleish)

column4: BRIEF-Unifi Inc Says Valueact Spring Acquired Co's Securities Based On Belief That They Were "Undervalued"
column6: * VALUEACT SPRING MASTER FUND - ACQUIRED UNIFI SECURITIES BASED ON BELIEF THAT THEY WERE “UNDERVALUED”, REPRESENTED “ATTRACTIVE INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITY”
column7: * VALUEACT SPRING MASTER FUND SAYS ANTICIPATE HAVING FURTHER DISCUSSIONS WITH UNIFI’S DIRECTORS IN CONNECTION WITH ITS INVESTMENT
column8: * VALUEACT SPRING MASTER FUND REPORTS 5.0% STAKE IN UNIFI AS OF MAY 11 - SEC FILING
column9: * VALUEACT SPRING MASTER FUND SAYS TALKS WITH UNIFI COVER RANGE OF ISSUES, INCLUDING WHETHER IT MAKES SENSE FOR VALUEACT CAPITAL EMPLOYEE TO BE ON BOARD Source text: (bit.ly/2ICOj0K) Further company coverage:

column4: BRIEF-Unifi Reports Q3 Earnings Per Share $0.01
column6: * Q3 SALES $165.9 MILLION VERSUS I/B/E/S VIEW $168.9 MILLION
column7: * QTRLY NET SALES INCREASED $5.0 MILLION, OR 3.1%, TO $165.9 MILLION, COMPARED TO $160.9 MILLION FOR Q3 OF FISCAL 2017
column8: * SAYS EXPECTS FISCAL 2018 OPERATING INCOME AND ADJUSTED EBITDA TO BE WELL BELOW FISCAL 2017 RESULTS
column9: * COMPANY CONTINUES TO EXPECT SALES VOLUME GROWTH DRIVING REVENUE GROWTH IN LOW-TO-MID SINGLE DIGIT PERCENTAGE RANGE FOR YEAR
column10: * CAPITAL EXPENDITURES ARE EXPECTED TO TOTAL $28 MILLION, WHICH IS $2 MILLION BELOW PRIOR OUTLOOK FOR 2018
column11: * Q3 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $0.40, REVENUE VIEW $168.9 MILLION -- THOMSON REUTERS I/B/E/S Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:
